Articles.Content:
I've been playing with the demo for about a month now, and finally bought in through Steam on Friday night.

To be honest, I hesitated because I didn't think I'd have fun with this - and I've had some awe inspiring crashes. I only made it into orbit on the demo thanks to scouting around Youtube, and am still working on it in the latest version. Well, I was wrong: There's definitely something to be said for getting an orbit just right, or getting your crew down safely anyway when you realize you forgot the parachute and/or decoupler.

When I was quite a bit smaller I had dreams of becoming an astronaut. Thanks for building a game that gives those dreams something to do.

Welcome aboard then, CatKnight. And as for tutorials, I suggest you check out the KSP wiki as they have some really good tutorials on everything from design to interplanetary maneuvers and historical replica missions. Trust me though, soon enough orbiting should be pretty easy for you with enough practice.

Edited April 21, 2013 by 0jam3290

Welcome to the community CatKnight

Dreams of space, of having the right stuff, of stepping on another world.....

We know these things are beyond us, yet we are still drawn to space, to look up at the stars and dream.

KSP helps us realize those dreams even if it's in a small way, and has brought together an amazing community, all of us dream of space
